pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [0f54c72a27](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19679/commits/0f54c72a2748eadf466f7e58da11b8173e2ea387)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ isAdjointPair_one`
`+-- IsAdjointPair`
`+-- IsAdjointPair.comp`
`+-- IsPairSelfAdjoint`
`+-- IsSelfAdjoint`
`+-- IsSkewAdjoint`
`+-- isAdjointPair_id`
`+-- isSkewAdjoint_iff_neg_self_adjoint`
`- IsAdjointPair.eq`
`- IsAdjointPair.mul`
`- IsAdjointPair.smul`
`- IsAdjointPair.sub`
`- isAdjointPair_iff_compLeft_eq_compRight`
`- isAdjointPair_toBilin`
`- isAdjointPair_toBilin'`
`- isPairSelfAdjointSubmodule`
`- isPairSelfAdjoint_equiv`
`- mem_isPairSelfAdjointSubmodule`
`- mem_selfAdjointSubmodule`
`- mem_skewAdjointSubmodule`
`- pairSelfAdjointMatricesSubmodule'`
`- selfAdjointSubmodule`
`- skewAdjointSubmodule`
`-+- isAdjointPair_zero`
`--+ IsAdjointPair.add`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

> @ocfnash I didn't touch `LinearMap.BilinForm.IsAdjointPair` at all here. In part, I was confused by the docstring on the `LinearAlgebra.SesquilinearForm` file which says:
> 
> > These forms are a special case of the bilinear maps defined in BilinearMap.lean and all basic lemmas about construction and elementary calculations are found there.

I think this doc string should be excised. I believe it's trying to express that much of the API for bilinear forms (values in scalars) is a special case of that for bilinear maps (values in any module) but I think it is confusing and prone to become a false statement.

> I don't see how these are a special case. If you want me to do something with `BilinForm.IsAdjointPair` I can do that too, just let me know what you think is best.

Could you try deleting it? I think it might be almost unused.
@ocfnash indeed, they were virtually unused. I've deleted them in this PR, but if you would prefer that to be a separate PR, it's just a `git revert` and `git cherry-pick` away.

Aside from the headline change, it's great to see the old duplicated `LinearMap.BilinForm.IsAdjointPair` etc killed off.

I don't suppose I can tempt you to consider the less trivial task of killing off [LinearMap.BilinForm.Nondegenerate](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/BilinearForm/Properties.html#LinearMap.BilinForm.Nondegenerate) since we have [LinearMap.Nondegenerate](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/SesquilinearForm.html#LinearMap.Nondegenerate)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12293489734/job/34306281147)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12293489734/job/34306281913)

```suggestion
Sesquilinear maps are a special case of the bilinear maps defined in `BilinearMap.lean` and `many`
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: make `LinearMap.IsAdjointPair` accept bare functions as arguments
